ul_677590: find "$users_dir"/*/workspace -mtime "+$(( DAYSOLD - 1 ))" -type f -delete

find "$users_dir"/*/workspace '(' -mtime "$DAYSOLD" -o -mtime "+$DAYSOLD" ')' \
                   -type f -delete

cd -P -- "$users_dir" || exit
du ...
find . ...

Explanations about Options.-mtime:
File's data was last modified n*24 hours ago. See the comments for -atime to
 understand how rounding affects the interpretation of file modification times.
Explanations about Options.-d: A synonym for -depth, for compatibility with FreeBSD, NetBSD, MacOS X and OpenBSD.

Top-3 Scripts:
au_963563: $ mkdir -p foo/2017/{October/{28..31},November/{1..3}}
$ touch -d 'now - 6 days' foo/2017/October/{28,29} foo/2017
$ find foo/* -mindepth 1 -mtime +5
foo/2017/October/28
foo/2017/October/29
$ find foo/* -mtime +5
foo/2017
foo/2017/October/28
foo/2017/October/29

Top-3 Scripts:
so_58419556: find /home/root/BACKUPS/backup.sql   | xargs zip -czvPf /home/root/BACKUPS/$(date +%F)_backup.sql.zip
find /home/root/BACKUPS -name "*.zip" -type f -mtime +15 -exec rm -f {} \;

Explanations about Options.-z:
Prompt for a multi-line comment for the entire zip archive. The comment is ended
 by a line containing just a period, or an end of file condition (^D on Unix, ^Z on
 MSDOS, OS/2, and VMS). The comment can be taken from a file:
Explanations about Options.-f:
Replace (freshen) an existing entry in the zip archive only if it has been modified
 more recently than the version already in the zip archive; unlike the update option
 (-u) this will not add files that are not already in the zip archive. For example:
Explanations about Options.-v: Verbose mode or print diagnostic version info.
Explanations about Options.-c:
Add one-line comments for each file. File operations (adding, updating) are done
 first, and the user is then prompted for a one-line comment for each file. Enter
 the comment followed by return, or just return for no comment.
